1567411647_16RcTW38vqF9GVrVMxJimcmbYRNu1.body: You don't follow CIA leaks? It's already been confirmed Earth is inhabited by exo-humanoids, but they aren't classified as such because of their relationship with our planet being longer than humans have been in existence, thus they aren't called extraterrestrials but rather intraterrestrials. They have bases all over the planet and have been around for hundreds of thousands if not millions of years. They may not be native to our planet the way we are, but this context is something we as humans see rather obtusely, because in the larger context of the universe, many species disregard such ideas as native homeworlds, since life can and will spawn and replicate in any hospitable environment. The greys are foreign, but have been here longer than us, making our claims of ownership here null.

1566944519_1587xjW5S4aJd1JKmLEsv1WRruZoW.body:
The purpose of living is objectively to learn, and this is self-evident in the many experiences that you, as the user, are capable of choosing to experience and not experience. Pleasure/enjoyment are chemical rewards that prompt you along the path of learning, not the motive to learn nor the ultimate reward for learning from any particular experience. The reward is the experience itself, and it can manifest itself in any form, pain, pleasure, sadness, horror, etc.

To isolate one particular sensation, which itself is widely understood as a tool for goading along the less intelligent who will continue existing for more and more momentary flashes of pleasure, is an unfortunate neglection, intended or not, of every individual's manifested will.
